security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill consisting only of documentation and reasoning methodology. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment variable reads are present. The skill provides a structured framework for analogical reasoning in plain YAML/markdown format.

content.user_title: Apply Past Experience to New Situations
content.value_statement: When facing new markets, products, or situations, you need a systematic way to transfer relevant knowledge from past experience. This skill provides a four-stage framework for analogical reasoning that identifies transferable patterns while accounting for context differences.
actual_capabilities: Identify relevant prior experience with documented outcomes using weighted criteria
Extract transferable structure from source domains including objects, relations, and constraints
Map source structure to new context by identifying preserved, modified, and broken elements
Generate adapted solutions with concrete action plans and confidence scores
limitations: Requires user to provide source cases with documented outcomes
Does not access external databases or knowledge sources
Cannot verify if mapped solutions will succeed in practice
Does not automate implementation of adapted solutions

use_cases.title: Expand to New Verticals
use_cases.description: Apply successful product strategies from existing verticals to new market segments with appropriate adaptations.

use_cases.title: Transfer Best Practices
use_cases.description: Map proven approaches from one industry to another client engagement while identifying necessary modifications.

use_cases.title: Adapt Playbooks
use_cases.description: Leverage experience from previous ventures or comparable companies when entering unfamiliar markets or launching new offerings.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Pattern Match
prompt_templates.prompt: We are entering [new market/domain]. We previously succeeded with [past case] in [source domain]. Help me apply analogical reasoning to map our approach.

prompt_templates.title: Product Expansion
prompt_templates.prompt: We want to build [new product type] for [new user segment]. We have experience building [existing product] for [existing segment]. Use analogical reasoning to identify what transfers and what needs adaptation.

prompt_templates.title: Cross-Domain Transfer
prompt_templates.description: We are facing [novel situation]. Find analogous cases from [domain] with documented outcomes. Map the structural elements and generate an adapted approach.

prompt_templates.title: Validation Mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Review our planned approach for [new situation] against [successful reference case]. Identify gaps in our mapping where we may be over-transferring or under-adapting. Provide specific recommendations with confidence levels.

output_examples.input: We are a B2B SaaS company entering the healthcare vertical. We previously succeeded in the financial services vertical with our compliance automation product.
output: Preserved Elements: Regulatory workflow automation, integration-first positioning, enterprise sales motion
Modified Elements: Compliance domains (financial â†’ healthcare regulations), Buyer process (procurement cycle adaptations)
Broken Elements: Finance-specific reporting formats, Banking-specific audit trails
Adapted Approach: Build healthcare-specific compliance templates, Partner with healthcare IT consultants, 18-month pilot timeline
Confidence: 0.65 - Key uncertainty is healthcare procurement complexity

best_practices: Select source cases with documented, measurable outcomes rather than anecdotal experience
Explicitly identify which elements transfer, adapt, or break for each mapping component
Assign confidence scores and document key uncertainties for each adaptation
anti_patterns: Mapping based on surface similarities rather than underlying structural relations
Assuming complete transfer without explicit context difference analysis
Using single source case without comparing multiple candidate analogies

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill is compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides a reasoning framework any LLM can follow.

faq.question: How long does the analogical process take?
faq.answer: Simple mappings complete in 5-10 minutes. Complex cross-domain transfers with multiple candidate sources may take 20-30 minutes.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with other reasoning skills?
faq.answer: Use Abductive reasoning first to explain the situation, then Analogical to find relevant patterns, followed by Causal for execution planning.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill that processes your input. It does not access external databases, files, or user data.

faq.question: Why is my mapping confidence low?
faq.answer: Low confidence typically indicates high context differences or insufficient source documentation. Retrieve additional candidate cases or accept longer validation cycles.

faq.question: How is this different from standard analogies?
faq.answer: This skill provides a systematic four-stage process with explicit mappings, quality gates, and confidence scoring rather than informal comparisons.
